result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Meindel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Provide DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge.  Pay all costs, fees and mandatory surcharges and assessments.  Costs to be paid from 25% of defendant's prison funds and on Extended supervision or civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

*****4-2-14 Judge Konkol, Court ordered JOC amended to reflect ZERO days of sentence credit on count one in case 14CF172 ******
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession or use of any illegal substance or alcohol to be monitored by random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: AS TO COUNT TWO AND THREE, EACH COUNT: Consecutive with any other sentence and concurrent to count one.  To be served in Wisconsin State Prison.
Consecutive to: as stated in count two.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Counts two and three.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE is 36 months with 15 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT is 12 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 months consecutive to any other sentence.
Count 2:    Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive with any other sentence and concurrent with Count 1.  Sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
Count 3:    Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction consecutive with any other sentence and concurrent with Count 1.  Sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
Conditions of Extended Supervision are:
- no violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause
- no possession or use of any illegal substance or alcohol to be monitored by random screens
- AODA assessment and treatment
- seek and maintain employment
- pay all costs, fees and mandatory surcharges and assessments 
Cost to be paid from 25% of defendant's prison funds and on extended supervision or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  Appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.

Defendant Christopher D Meindel in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Christopher D Meindel in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 1, 2 & 3:  Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.
As to Count 4:  pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.

Defendant Christopher D Meindel in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Christopher D Meindel in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for a Plea Date to Branch 44.  Plea date scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christopher D Meindel in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Christopher D Meindel in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2, 3, & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
